Blackpool (2020-present)

James Husband is a defender who played at Fulham in two seperate loan spells from Middlesbrough in 2015. His two spells at Craven Cottage - the first during 2014-15 on loan from Middlesbrough for the final stages of the season, and the second spell for one month to cover the recently acquired but injured Luke Garbutt were largely successful for James and the fans were impressed. An attacking left back by trade, James had played for Doncaster Rovers and Middlesbrough prior to his loan moves. His performances led to many fans wanting a permanent signature during the summer of 2015.

Career[]

Before Fulham[]

Fulham (2015)[]

James joined the club on 25 March 2015, in a loan move until the end of the season from Middlesbrough, with the deal seeing Fernando Amorebieta travelling in the opposite direction. He only made five appearances for the club, yet the fans were impressed by his displays and there were calls for Fulham to attempt to sign him permanently.

After an early injury to the recent loan signing Luke Garbutt, Fulham signed James once more on loan on 28 August 2015, this time on a one month loan. Fernando Amorebieta again went in the opposite direction for the remainder of the season.
